name: Heat, drying veneer, hardwood, at veneer mill, E
description:
All weights given on an ovendry basis.

Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

category.name: 3212: Veneer, Plywood, and Engineered Wood Product Manufacturing

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Questionnaires from  4 veneer mills and 5 flooring plants in the E. United States representing 32 states.
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: Only mass allocation factors are available for the multi-functional processes (disregard economic allocation factor values-they are mass allocation factors).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: E= Eastern US United States. The states included MN, IA, MO, WI, IL, NJ, OH, IN, MI, WV, PA, MD, DW, NJ, NY, ME, VT, NH, RI, MA, CT, VA, KY, AR, LA, MS, AL, FL,GA, NC, SC, and TN

exchanges.description: Amount of heat consumed on-site from burning wood and fossil fuels  during veneer drying. Represents 71.3% veneer mill use of heat.

flow.name: Heat; drying veneer; hardwood; at veneer mill
categoryPath: 3212: Veneer, Plywood, and Engineered Wood Product Manufacturing

exchanges.description: Process energy needed to produce 1.0 m3 engineered wood flooring; all fuel quantities listed below were multipled by using the following HHV; 20.9 MJ per OD kg for wood, 38.4 MJ per cubic meter for natural gas, 38.7 MJ per liter for fuel oil #1 and #2, 41.8 MJ per liter for fuel oil #6, and 26.6 MJ per liter for propane to determine the process energy input

defaultProvider.name: Liquefied petroleum gas, combusted in industrial boiler

exchanges.description: Amount of heat energy consumed during the prefinishing process. Represents 35.7% of total process energy for flooring plant

categoryPath: 3212: Veneer, Plywood, and Engineered Wood Product Manufacturing
